diffchange-inline">the</del> [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">pen</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">names</del>]] '''Alex R. Stuart''' and '''Stuart Gordon'''.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div><ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Gordon</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">began</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">publishing</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">science</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">fiction</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">with</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">"A Light in the Sky" for [[New_Worlds_(magazine)|New Worlds]] in 1965 as '''Richard A. Gordon.'''</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Later</ins> his <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">publisher</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">ask him to adopt a</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">pseudonym</ins> for the risk of confusing him with the [[Richard Gordon (English author)|author]] of the ''[[Doctor Series|Doctor]]'' books<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">.</ins> Gordon <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">initially</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">adopted</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">the</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">pen</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">name</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">'''Alex</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Stuart''',</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">but</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">was again asked to change names due to complaints from author Violet Vivian Stuart, who published</ins> [[<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Historical_fiction|historical</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">fiction</ins>]]<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> under that name.  He then adopted the name</ins> '''Alex R. Stuart''' and<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> later took on the pen name</ins> '''Stuart Gordon'''<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">。&lt;ref name=locus/&gt; Gordon's later work was published under his own name</ins>.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> </ins></div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the ''The Bikers'': To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano. </div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the ''The Bikers'': To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano. </div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 10:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 9:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In ''[[Fire in the Abyss]]'' time-warped Sir [[Humphrey Gilbert]] passes through [[Buckie]], where Gordon grew up.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In ''[[Fire in the Abyss]]'' time-warped Sir [[Humphrey Gilbert]] passes through [[Buckie]], where Gordon grew up.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Gordon <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">collapsed</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">at</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">the [[Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)|Lianhua Road Subway Station]]</del> in <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">the</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Shanghai</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Metro]]</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">and</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">died</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">of</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">a</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">heart attack on February 7, 2009</del>.&lt;ref<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">&gt;http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID</del>=<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">8580&lt;</del>/<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">ref</del>&gt;<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> He had been teaching at [[Shanghai High School International Division]] since 2005.</del></div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Gordon <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">began</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">teaching</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">abroad</ins> in <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">his</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">50s.</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">In</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">2003</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">he</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">relocated</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">to</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">China</ins>.&lt;ref<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> name</ins>=<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">locus</ins>/&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Gordon collapsed at the [[Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)|Lianhua Road Subway Station]] in the [[Shanghai Metro]] of a heart attack and died in hosipital on February 7, 2009.&lt;ref name=locus/&gt;&lt;ref&gt;http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580&lt;/ref&gt; He had been teaching at [[Shanghai High School International Division]] since 2005.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==Partial list of works==</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==Partial list of works==</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 01:28, 3 March 2009</h2> <div class="thumb tright"> <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/220px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" width="220" height="293" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/330px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/440px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640" /></a> <div class="thumbcaption"> <div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div> Richard Gordon in 2007 holding two of his earliest works, <i>The Bike from Hell</i> and <i>The Devil’s Rider</i></div> </div> </div> <p><b>Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon</b> (18 May 1947 – 7 February 2009) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-locus_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-locus-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Gordon began publishing science fiction with "A Light in the Sky" for <a href="/wiki/New_Worlds_(magazine)" title="New Worlds (magazine)">New Worlds</a> in 1965 as <b>Richard A. Gordon.</b> Later his publisher ask him to adopt a pseudonym for the risk of confusing him with the <a href="/wiki/Richard_Gordon_(English_author)" title="Richard Gordon (English author)">author</a> of the <i><a href="/wiki/Doctor_Series" title="Doctor Series">Doctor</a></i> books. Gordon initially adopted the pen name <b>Alex Stuart</b>, but was again asked to change names due to complaints from author Violet Vivian Stuart, who published <a href="/wiki/Historical_fiction" title="Historical fiction">historical fiction</a> under that name. He then adopted the name <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and later took on the pen name <b>Stuart Gordon</b>。<sup id="cite_ref-locus_1-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-locus-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> Gordon's later work was published under his own name.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon began teaching abroad in his 50s. In 2003 he relocated to China.<sup id="cite_ref-locus_1-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-locus-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> Gordon collapsed at the <a href="/wiki/Lianhua_Road_(Shanghai_Metro)" title="Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)" class="mw-redirect">Lianhua Road Subway Station</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_Metro" title="Shanghai Metro">Shanghai Metro</a> of a heart attack and died in hosipital on February 7, 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-locus_1-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-locus-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> He had been teaching at <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_High_School_International_Division" title="Shanghai High School International Division">Shanghai High School International Division</a> since 2005.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a></i> (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a></i> (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a></i> (1972)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a></i> (1973)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a></i> (1974)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a></i> (1981)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History</i> (1998) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History</i> (1999) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron</i> (2000) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="diff-context"></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 12:28, 26 February 2009</h2> <div class="thumb tright"> <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/220px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" width="220" height="293" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/330px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/440px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640" /></a> <div class="thumbcaption"> <div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div> Richard Gordon in 2007 holding two of his earliest works, <i>The Bike from Hell</i> and <i>The Devil’s Rider</i></div> </div> </div> <p><b>Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon</b> (1947 – 7 February 2009) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name – for the risk of confusing him with the <a href="/wiki/Richard_Gordon_(English_author)" title="Richard Gordon (English author)">author</a> of the <i><a href="/wiki/Doctor_Series" title="Doctor Series">Doctor</a></i> books – Gordon published many of his best known works under the <a href="/wiki/Pen_names" title="Pen names" class="mw-redirect">pen names</a> <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and <b>Stuart Gordon</b>.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon collapsed at the <a href="/wiki/Lianhua_Road_(Shanghai_Metro)" title="Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)" class="mw-redirect">Lianhua Road Subway Station</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_Metro" title="Shanghai Metro">Shanghai Metro</a> and died of a heart attack on February 7, 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> He had been teaching at <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_High_School_International_Division" title="Shanghai High School International Division">Shanghai High School International Division</a> since 2005.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a></i> (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a></i> (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a></i> (1972)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a></i> (1973)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a></i> (1974)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a></i> (1981)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History</i> (1998) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History</i> (1999) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron</i> (2000) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580">http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580</a></span></li> </ol> </div> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/g/stuart-gordon/">Stuart Gordon at Fantasticfiction.co.uk</a></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/30px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png" width="30" height="24" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/45px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/60px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="130" data-file-height="105" /></a></td> <td><i>This article about a science fiction writer is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>{{sf-writer-stub}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 09:01, 14 February 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-notice" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><a href="/wiki/File:Ambox_current_red.svg" class="image"><img alt="Ambox current red.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/40px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png" width="40" height="32" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/60px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/80px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="360" data-file-height="290" /></a></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">This article <b>is about <a href="/wiki/Deaths_in_2015" title="Deaths in 2015">a person who has recently died</a></b>. Some information, such as the circumstances of the person's death and surrounding events, may change as more facts become known. Initial news reports may be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources#Breaking_news" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">unreliable</a>.</span></td> </tr> </table> <div class="thumb tright"> <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/220px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" width="220" height="293" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/330px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/440px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640" /></a> <div class="thumbcaption"> <div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div> Richard Gordon in 2007 holding two of his earliest works, <i>The Bike from Hell</i> and <i>The Devil’s Rider</i></div> </div> </div> <p><b>Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon</b> (1947 – 7 February 2009) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name – for the risk of confusing him with the <a href="/wiki/Richard_Gordon_(English_author)" title="Richard Gordon (English author)">author</a> of the <i><a href="/wiki/Doctor_Series" title="Doctor Series">Doctor</a></i> books – Gordon published many of his best known works under the <a href="/wiki/Pen_names" title="Pen names" class="mw-redirect">pen names</a> <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and <b>Stuart Gordon</b>.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon collapsed at the <a href="/wiki/Lianhua_Road_(Shanghai_Metro)" title="Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)" class="mw-redirect">Lianhua Road Subway Station</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_Metro" title="Shanghai Metro">Shanghai Metro</a> and died of a heart attack on February 7, 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> He had been teaching at <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_High_School_International_Division" title="Shanghai High School International Division">Shanghai High School International Division</a> since 2005.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a></i> (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a></i> (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a></i> (1972)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a></i> (1973)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a></i> (1974)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a></i> (1981)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History</i> (1998) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History</i> (1999) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron</i> (2000) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580">http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580</a></span></li> </ol> </div> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/g/stuart-gordon/">Stuart Gordon at Fantasticfiction.co.uk</a></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/30px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png" width="30" height="24" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/45px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/60px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="130" data-file-height="105" /></a></td> <td><i>This article about a science fiction writer is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. diffchange-inline">[[</del>1947<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">-</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[</del>February <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">7]] [[</del>2009<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]] </del>) was a [[Scotland|Scottish]] author born in [[Banff and Macduff|Banff]], [[Scotland]] who wrote numerous [[science fiction]] novels, [[encyclopedias]], and [[travel guide]]s. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon''' (1947 <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">&amp;ndash; 7</ins> February 2009) was a [[Scotland|Scottish]] author born in [[Banff and Macduff|Banff]], [[Scotland]] who wrote numerous [[science fiction]] novels, [[encyclopedias]], and [[travel guide]]s. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">--because</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">there</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">was</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">already</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">a</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">published</del> Richard Gordon<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">--</del>Gordon published many of his best known works under the [[pen names]] '''Alex R. colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>[[Category:2009 deaths]]</div></td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 11:31, 13 February 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-notice" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><a href="/wiki/File:Ambox_current_red.svg" class="image"><img alt="Ambox current red.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/40px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png" width="40" height="32" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/60px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/Ambox_current_red.svg/80px-Ambox_current_red.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="360" data-file-height="290" /></a></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">This article <b>is about <a href="/wiki/Deaths_in_2015" title="Deaths in 2015">a person who has recently died</a></b>. Some information, such as the circumstances of the person's death and surrounding events, may change as more facts become known. Initial news reports may be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources#Breaking_news" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">unreliable</a>.</span></td> </tr> </table> <div class="thumb tright"> <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/220px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" width="220" height="293" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/330px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/440px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640" /></a> <div class="thumbcaption"> <div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div> Richard Gordon in 2007 holding two of his earliest works, <i>The Bike from Hell</i> and <i>The Devil’s Rider</i></div> </div> </div> <p><b>Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon</b> (1947 – 7 February 2009) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name – for the risk of confusing him with the <a href="/wiki/Richard_Gordon_(English_author)" title="Richard Gordon (English author)">author</a> of the <i><a href="/wiki/Doctor_Series" title="Doctor Series">Doctor</a></i> books – Gordon published many of his best known works under the <a href="/wiki/Pen_names" title="Pen names" class="mw-redirect">pen names</a> <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and <b>Stuart Gordon</b>.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon collapsed at the <a href="/wiki/Lianhua_Road_(Shanghai_Metro)" title="Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)" class="mw-redirect">Lianhua Road Subway Station</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_Metro" title="Shanghai Metro">Shanghai Metro</a> and died of a heart attack on February 7, 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> He had been teaching at <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_High_School_International_Division" title="Shanghai High School International Division">Shanghai High School International Division</a> since 2005.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a></i> (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a></i> (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a></i> (1972)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a></i> (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a></i> (1973)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a></i> (1974)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a></i> (1975)</li> <li><i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a></i> (1981)</li> <li><i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History</i> (1998) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History</i> (1999) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron</i> (2000) - Published as Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580">http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580</a></span></li> </ol> </div> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/g/stuart-gordon/">Stuart Gordon at Fantasticfiction.co.uk</a></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/30px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png" width="30" height="24" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/45px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/60px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="130" data-file-height="105" /></a></td> <td><i>This article about a science fiction writer is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 01:46, 12 February 2009</h2> <div class="thumb tright"> <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/220px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" width="220" height="293" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/330px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/440px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640" /></a> <div class="thumbcaption"> <div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div> Richard Gordon in 2007 holding two of his earliest works, <i>The Bike from Hell</i> and <i>The Devil’s Rider</i></div> </div> </div> <p><b>Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon</b> (<a href="/wiki/1947" title="1947">1947</a> – <a href="/wiki/February_7" title="February 7">February 7</a> <a href="/wiki/2009" title="2009">2009</a>) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name — because there was already a published Richard Gordon — Gordon published many of his best known works under the <a href="/wiki/Pen_names" title="Pen names" class="mw-redirect">pen names</a> <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and <b>Stuart Gordon</b>.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon collapsed at the <a href="/wiki/Lianhua_Road_(Shanghai_Metro)" title="Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)" class="mw-redirect">Lianhua Road Subway Station</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_Metro" title="Shanghai Metro">Shanghai Metro</a> and died of a heart attack on February 7, 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> He had been teaching at <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_High_School_International_Division" title="Shanghai High School International Division">Shanghai High School International Division</a> since 2005.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a>. (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a>. (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a> (1972)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a>. (1973)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a> (1974)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God. (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God.</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a> (1981)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a>. (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation.</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia.</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends.</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History.</i> (1998) - Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History.</i> (1999)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron.</i> (2000)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580">http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580</a></span></li> </ol> </div> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/g/stuart-gordon/">Stuart Gordon at Fantasticfiction.co.uk</a></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/30px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png" width="30" height="24" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/45px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/60px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="130" data-file-height="105" /></a></td> <td><i>This article about a science fiction writer is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist <a href="/wiki/February_7" title="February 7">February 7</a> <a href="/wiki/2009" title="2009">2009</a> ) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name--because there was already a published Richard Gordon--Gordon published many of his best known works under the <a href="/wiki/Pen_names" title="Pen names" class="mw-redirect">pen names</a> <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and <b>Stuart Gordon</b>.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon collapsed in <a href="/wiki/Lianhua_Road_(Shanghai_Metro)" title="Lianhua Road (Shanghai Metro)" class="mw-redirect">Lianhua Road Station</a> of <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_Metro" title="Shanghai Metro">Shanghai Metro</a> and died of a heart attack on February 7, 2009.<a rel="nofollow" class="external autonumber" href="http://www.shs.sh.cn/News/modules/newsmanager/shownews.aspx?NewsID=8580">[1]</a> He had been teaching in <a href="/wiki/Shanghai_High_School_International_Division" title="Shanghai High School International Division">Shanghai High School International Division</a> for many years. He was known widely as a humorous, intelligent, and understanding teacher that was respected greatly by his students. Many of them were shocked and grieved at Gordon's sudden death.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a>. (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a>. (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a> (1972)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a>. (1973)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a> (1974)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God. (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God.</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a> (1981)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a>. (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation.</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia.</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends.</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History.</i> (1998) - Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History.</i> (1999)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron.</i> (2000)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/g/stuart-gordon/">Stuart Gordon at Fantasticfiction.co.uk</a></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/30px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png" width="30" height="24" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/45px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/60px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="130" data-file-height="105" /></a></td> <td><i>This article about a science fiction writer is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">Richard Gordon (Scottish author): Difference between revisions</h1> 						<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content"> 									<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div> 								<div id="contentSub"></div> 												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump"> 					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-head">navigation</a>, id="mw-diff-otitle1"><strong><a href="/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;oldid=269364928" title="Richard Gordon (Scottish author)">Revision as of 18:18, 8 February 2009</a> <span class="mw-diff-edit">(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;action=edit&amp;oldid=269364928" title="Richard Gordon (Scottish author)">edit</a>)</span></strong></div><div id="mw-diff-otitle2"><a href="/wiki/User:David_Straub" title="User:David Straub" class="mw-userlink">David Straub</a> <span class="mw-usertoollinks">(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:David_Straub" title="User class="comment">(added death date, changed tense, changed tags)</span></div><div id="mw-diff-otitle5"></div><div id="mw-diff-otitle4"><a href="/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;diff=prev&amp;oldid=269364928" title="Richard Gordon (Scottish author)" id="differences-prevlink">← Previous edit</a></div></td> 				<td colspan='2' class='diff-ntitle'><div id="mw-diff-ntitle1"><strong><a href="/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;oldid=269742172" title="Richard Gordon (Scottish author)">Revision as of 10:09, 10 February 2009</a> <span class="mw-diff-edit">(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;action=edit&amp;oldid=269742172" title="Richard Gordon (Scottish author)">edit</a>)</span> <span class="mw-diff-undo">(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;action=edit&amp;undoafter=269364928&amp;undo=269742172" title="&quot;Undo&quot; reverts this edit and opens the edit form in preview mode. It allows adding a reason in the summary.">undo</a>)</span></strong></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle2"><a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/116.227.134.98" title="Special:Contributions/116.227.134.98" class="mw-userlink mw-anonuserlink">116.227.134.98</a> <span class="mw-usertoollinks">(<a href="/w/index.php?title=User_talk:116.227.134.98&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="User talk:116.227.134.98 (page does not exist)">talk</a>)</span> </div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle3"></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle5"></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle4"><a href="/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;diff=next&amp;oldid=269742172" title="Richard Gordon (Scottish author)" id="differences-nextlink">Next edit →</a></div></td> 				</tr><tr><td colspan='4' style='text-align: center;' class='diff-multi'>(One intermediate revision by one other user not shown)</td></tr><tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 9:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 9:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In ''[[Fire in the Abyss]]'' time-warped Sir [[Humphrey Gilbert]] passes through [[Buckie]], where Gordon grew up.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In ''[[Fire in the Abyss]]'' time-warped Sir [[Humphrey Gilbert]] passes through [[Buckie]], where Gordon grew up.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Gordon collapsed and died in a Shanghai train station while teaching in <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[</del>Shanghai<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</del> on February 7, 2009.  </div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Gordon collapsed and died<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> of a heart attack</ins> in a Shanghai train station while teaching in Shanghai<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> High School International Division</ins> on February 7, 2009. <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">He has been teaching there for many years. He was known widely as a humorous, intelligent, and understanding teacher that was respected greatly by his students. Many of them were shocked and grieved at Gordon's sudden death.</ins> </div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Jerry Yu was his most hated student. By far.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==Partial list of works==</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==Partial list of works==</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 10:09, 10 February 2009</h2> <div class="thumb tright"> <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/220px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" width="220" height="293" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/330px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/440px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640" /></a> <div class="thumbcaption"> <div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div> Richard Gordon in 2007 holding two of his earliest works, <i>The Bike from Hell</i> and <i>The Devil’s Rider</i></div> </div> </div> <p><b>Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon</b> (<a href="/wiki/1947" title="1947">1947</a> - <a href="/wiki/February_7" title="February 7">February 7</a> <a href="/wiki/2009" title="2009">2009</a> ) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name--because there was already a published Richard Gordon--Gordon published many of his best known works under the <a href="/wiki/Pen_names" title="Pen names" class="mw-redirect">pen names</a> <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and <b>Stuart Gordon</b>.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon collapsed and died of a heart attack in a Shanghai train station while teaching in Shanghai High School International Division on February 7, 2009. He has been teaching there for many years. He was known widely as a humorous, intelligent, and understanding teacher that was respected greatly by his students. Many of them were shocked and grieved at Gordon's sudden death.</p> <p>Jerry Yu was his most hated student. By far.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a>. (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a>. (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a> (1972)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a>. (1973)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a> (1974)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God. (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God.</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a> (1981)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a>. (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation.</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia.</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends.</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History.</i> (1998) - Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History.</i> (1999)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron.</i> (2000)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/g/stuart-gordon/">Stuart Gordon at Fantasticfiction.co.uk</a></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/30px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png" width="30" height="24" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/45px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/60px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="130" data-file-height="105" /></a></td> <td><i>This article about a science fiction writer is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richard_Gordon_(Scottish_author)&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist class="diff-context"><div>{{sf-writer-stub}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{sf-writer-stub}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 04:08, 9 February 2009</h2> <div class="thumb tright"> <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/220px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" width="220" height="293" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/330px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG/440px-Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640" /></a> <div class="thumbcaption"> <div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Richard_Gordon_Shanghai_China_2007.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div> Richard Gordon in 2007 holding two of his earliest works, <i>The Bike from Hell</i> and <i>The Devil’s Rider</i></div> </div> </div> <p><b>Richard Alexander Steuart Gordon</b> (<a href="/wiki/1947" title="1947">1947</a> - <a href="/wiki/February_7" title="February 7">February 7</a> <a href="/wiki/2009" title="2009">2009</a> ) was a <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scottish</a> author born in <a href="/wiki/Banff_and_Macduff" title="Banff and Macduff" class="mw-disambig">Banff</a>, <a href="/wiki/Scotland" title="Scotland">Scotland</a> who wrote numerous <a href="/wiki/Science_fiction" title="Science fiction">science fiction</a> novels, <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedias" title="Encyclopedias" class="mw-redirect">encyclopedias</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Travel_guide" title="Travel guide" class="mw-redirect">travel guides</a>. Gordon's novels are noted for their mix of historical fact and creative fictionalized events.</p> <p>Due to objections from publishers to his using his given name--because there was already a published Richard Gordon--Gordon published many of his best known works under the <a href="/wiki/Pen_names" title="Pen names" class="mw-redirect">pen names</a> <b>Alex R. Stuart</b> and <b>Stuart Gordon</b>.</p> <p>One interesting note of Gordon's work is the colorful dedications he had in his earliest works, such as the following dedication for the <i>The Bikers</i>: To She Who Types Like a Drunken Midget Playing The Piano.</p> <p>While Gordon has never written fictional pieces set in Scotland, the characters in his books occasionally pass through his hometown. In <i><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a></i> time-warped Sir <a href="/wiki/Humphrey_Gilbert" title="Humphrey Gilbert">Humphrey Gilbert</a> passes through <a href="/wiki/Buckie" title="Buckie">Buckie</a>, where Gordon grew up.</p> <p>Gordon collapsed and died of a heart attack in a Shanghai train station while teaching in Shanghai High School International Division on February 7, 2009. He has been teaching there for many years. He was known widely as a humorous, intelligent, and understanding teacher that was respected greatly by his students. Many of them were shocked and grieved at Gordon's sudden death.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Partial_list_of_works">Partial list of works</span></h2> <p>Works are published under pseudonym Stuart Gordon unless otherwise noted.</p> <ul> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bikers</a>. (1971) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Outlaws</a>. (1972)- published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Time_Story&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Time Story (page does not exist)">Time Story</a> (1972)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Bike from Hell</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Bikers_(novel_series)" title="The Bikers (novel series)">The Devil's Rider</a>. (1973) - published under pen name Alex R. Stuart</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">One-Eye</a>. (1973)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Two-Eyes</a> (1974)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Suaine_and_the_Crow-God.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suaine and the Crow-God. (page does not exist)">Suaine and the Crow-God.</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/The_Eyes_(novel_series)" title="The Eyes (novel series)">Three-Eyes</a> (1975)</li> <li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Smile_on_the_void:_The_mythhistory_of_Ralph_M%27Botu_Kitaj&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj (page does not exist)">Smile on the void: The mythhistory of Ralph M'Botu Kitaj</a> (1981)</li> <li><a href="/wiki/Fire_in_the_Abyss" title="Fire in the Abyss">Fire in the Abyss</a>. (1983)</li> <li><i>Archon.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>The Hidden World.</i> (1988)</li> <li><i>Down the Drain: Water, Pollution and Privatisation.</i> (1989) - with coauthor <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jennie_Smith&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jennie Smith (page does not exist)">Jennie Smith</a></li> <li><i>The Mask.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>Eye in the Stone.</i> (1990)</li> <li><i>The Paranormal: An Illustrated Encyclopedia.</i> (1992)</li> <li><i>The Encyclopedia of Myths and Legends.</i> (1993)</li> <li><i>The Book of Miracles: From Lazarus to Lourdes.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Hoaxes: An A-Z of famous fakes, frauds and cons.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>The Book of Curses: True Tales of Voodoo, Hoodoo and Hex.</i> (1995)</li> <li><i>Round Iverness, The Black Isle and Nairn: Walks and History.</i> (1998) - Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Moray, Badenoch and Strathspey: Walks and History.</i> (1999)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> <li><i>Round Aberdeen from Beeside to the Deveron.</i> (2000)- Published under Richard Gordon</li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/g/stuart-gordon/">Stuart Gordon at Fantasticfiction.co.uk</a></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/30px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png" width="30" height="24" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/45px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg/60px-Nuvola_apps_konquest.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="130" data-file-height="105" /></a></td> <td><i>This article about a science fiction writer is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>.
