Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman], The Washington Post, February 13, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman], The Washington Post, February 13, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Allegheny County Coroner [[Cyril H. Wecht]], who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm How slaying victim came to know her attackers], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Allegheny County Coroner [[Cyril H. Wecht]], who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm How slaying victim came to know her attackers], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>==See also==</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>* [[Sadistic personality disorder]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>* [[Murder of Suzanne Capper]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>* [[Murder of Kelly Anne Bates]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 11:01, 30 September 2010</h2> <p>The <b>murder of Jennifer Lee Daugherty</b> (November 8, 1979 – February 11, 2010) was committed in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania" title="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> Daugherty, who was <a href="/wiki/Mental_retardation" title="Mental retardation" class="mw-redirect">mentally disabled</a>, was <a href="/wiki/Torture_murder" title="Torture murder" class="mw-redirect">tortured and murdered</a> before being wrapped in <a href="/wiki/Christmas_decoration" title="Christmas decoration">Christmas decorations</a>, put inside a garbage can and dumped in the parking lot of Greensburg Salem Middle School.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>During <a href="/wiki/Torture" title="Torture">torture</a> and abuse sessions, which lasted for 36 hours, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <a href="/wiki/Feces" title="Feces">feces</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urine" title="Urine">urine</a><sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Detergent" title="Detergent">detergent</a>; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake <a href="/wiki/Suicide_note" title="Suicide note">suicide note</a>; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup> According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6"><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7"><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2> <ul> <li><a href="/wiki/Sadistic_personality_disorder" title="Sadistic personality disorder">Sadistic personality disorder</a></li> <li><a href="/wiki/Murder_of_Suzanne_Capper" title="Murder of Suzanne Capper">Murder of Suzanne Capper</a></li> <li><a href="/wiki/Murder_of_Kelly_Anne_Bates" title="Murder of Kelly Anne Bates">Murder of Kelly Anne Bates</a></li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation news">Kotz, Pete (February 19, 2010). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.truecrimereport.com/2010/02/jennifer_daugherty_mentally_di.php">"Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled, was Tortured &amp; Murdered by Her 'Friends'; 6 Arrested"</a>. <i>True Crime Report</i> (New York)<span class="reference-accessdate">. class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 07:29, 28 September 2010</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-content ambox-Notability" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">The topic of this article <b>may not meet Wikipedia's <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Notability_(people)" title="Wikipedia:Notability (people)">notability guideline for biographies</a></b>. <span class="hide-when-compact">Please help to establish notability by adding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">reliable, secondary sources</a> about the topic. If notability cannot be established, the article is likely to be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merge" title="Wikipedia:Merge" class="mw-redirect">merged</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Redirect" title="Wikipedia:Redirect">redirected</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Deletion_policy" title="Wikipedia:Deletion policy">deleted</a>.<br /> <small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;num=50">"Murder of Jennifer Daugherty"</a>&#160;–&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;tbm=nws">news</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">books</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">scholar</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/images?safe=off&amp;tbm=isch&amp;tbs=sur:fmc&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+-site:wikipedia.org+-site:wikimedia.org">free images</a></span></small></span> <small><i>(February 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Jennifer Lee Daugherty</b> (November 8, 1979 – February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was <a href="/wiki/Torture_murder" title="Torture murder" class="mw-redirect">tortured and murdered</a> in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg, Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>During <a href="/wiki/Torture" title="Torture">torture</a> and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <a href="/wiki/Feces" title="Feces">feces</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urine" title="Urine">urine</a><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Detergent" title="Detergent">detergent</a>; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake <a href="/wiki/Suicide_note" title="Suicide note">suicide note</a>; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2> <ul> <li><a href="/wiki/Sadistic_personality_disorder" title="Sadistic personality disorder">Sadistic personality disorder</a></li> <li><a href="/wiki/Murder_of_Suzanne_Capper" title="Murder of Suzanne Capper">Murder of Suzanne Capper</a></li> <li><a href="/wiki/Murder_of_Kelly_Anne_Bates" title="Murder of Kelly Anne Bates">Murder of Kelly Anne Bates</a></li> </ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span March 4, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>'''Jennifer Lee Daugherty''' (<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Thursday, </del>November 8, 1979 –<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> Thursday,</del> February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was [[Torture murder|tortured and murdered]] in [[Greensburg, Pennsylvania]] in February 2010.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Jennifer Lee Daugherty''' (November 8, 1979 – February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was [[Torture murder|tortured and murdered]] in [[Greensburg, Pennsylvania]] in February 2010.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>During [[torture]] and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume [[feces]] and [[urine]]&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and [[detergent]]; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake [[suicide note]]; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>During [[torture]] and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume [[feces]] and [[urine]]&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and [[detergent]]; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake [[suicide note]]; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 22:17, 27 September 2010</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-content ambox-Notability" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">The topic of this article <b>may not meet Wikipedia's <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Notability_(people)" title="Wikipedia:Notability (people)">notability guideline for biographies</a></b>. <span class="hide-when-compact">Please help to establish notability by adding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">reliable, secondary sources</a> about the topic. If notability cannot be established, the article is likely to be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merge" title="Wikipedia:Merge" class="mw-redirect">merged</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Redirect" title="Wikipedia:Redirect">redirected</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Deletion_policy" title="Wikipedia:Deletion policy">deleted</a>.<br /> <small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;num=50">"Murder of Jennifer Daugherty"</a>&#160;–&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;tbm=nws">news</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">books</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">scholar</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/images?safe=off&amp;tbm=isch&amp;tbs=sur:fmc&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+-site:wikipedia.org+-site:wikimedia.org">free images</a></span></small></span> <small><i>(February 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Jennifer Lee Daugherty</b> (November 8, 1979 – February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was <a href="/wiki/Torture_murder" title="Torture murder" class="mw-redirect">tortured and murdered</a> in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg, Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>During <a href="/wiki/Torture" title="Torture">torture</a> and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <a href="/wiki/Feces" title="Feces">feces</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urine" title="Urine">urine</a><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Detergent" title="Detergent">detergent</a>; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake <a href="/wiki/Suicide_note" title="Suicide note">suicide note</a>; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm">6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml">Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers</a>, CBS News, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html">Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman</a>, The Washington Post, February 13, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-5">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm">How slaying victim came to know her attackers</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010</span></li> </ol> </div> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/60px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 1.5x, Daugherty''' (<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Thursday, </del>November 8, 1979 –<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> Thursday,</del> February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was [[Torture murder|tortured and murdered]] in [[Greensburg, Pennsylvania]] in February 2010.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Jennifer Lee Daugherty''' (November 8, 1979 – February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was [[Torture murder|tortured and murdered]] in [[Greensburg, Pennsylvania]] in February 2010.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>During [[torture]] and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume [[feces]] and [[urine]]&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and [[detergent]]; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake [[suicide note]]; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>During [[torture]] and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume [[feces]] and [[urine]]&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and [[detergent]]; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake [[suicide note]]; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 14:</td>   <td colspan="2" title="Wikipedia:Orphan">orphan</a>, as no other articles <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Whatlinkshere&amp;target=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty&amp;namespace=0">link to it</a></b>. Please <a href="/wiki/Help:Link" title="Help:Link">introduce links</a> to this page from <span class="plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&amp;redirs=1&amp;search=Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty&amp;fulltext=Search&amp;ns0=1&amp;title=Special%3ASearch&amp;advanced=1&amp;fulltext=Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty">related articles</a></span>; try the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//edwardbetts.com/find_link?q=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty">Find link tool</a> for suggestions. <small><i>(March 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-content ambox-Notability" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">The topic of this article <b>may not meet Wikipedia's <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Notability_(people)" title="Wikipedia:Notability (people)">notability guideline for biographies</a></b>. <span class="hide-when-compact">Please help to establish notability by adding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">reliable, secondary sources</a> about the topic. If notability cannot be established, the article is likely to be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merge" title="Wikipedia:Merge" class="mw-redirect">merged</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Redirect" title="Wikipedia:Redirect">redirected</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Deletion_policy" title="Wikipedia:Deletion policy">deleted</a>.<br /> <small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;num=50">"Murder of Jennifer Daugherty"</a>&#160;–&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;tbm=nws">news</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">books</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">scholar</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/images?safe=off&amp;tbm=isch&amp;tbs=sur:fmc&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+-site:wikipedia.org+-site:wikimedia.org">free images</a></span></small></span> <small><i>(February 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Jennifer Lee Daugherty</b> (November 8, 1979 – February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was <a href="/wiki/Torture_murder" title="Torture murder" class="mw-redirect">tortured and murdered</a> in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg, Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>During <a href="/wiki/Torture" title="Torture">torture</a> and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <a href="/wiki/Feces" title="Feces">feces</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urine" title="Urine">urine</a><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Detergent" title="Detergent">detergent</a>; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake <a href="/wiki/Suicide_note" title="Suicide note">suicide note</a>; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm">6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml">Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers</a>, CBS News, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html">Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman</a>, The Washington Post, February 13, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-5">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm">How slaying victim came to know her attackers</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010</span></li> </ol> </div> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/40px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" width="40" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/60px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/80px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="300" /></a></td> <td><i>This <a href="/wiki/Crime" title="Crime">crime</a>-related article is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini" style="position: absolute; right: 15px; display: none;"> <ul> <li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Crime-stub" title="Template:Crime-stub"><span title="View this Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>'''Jennifer Lee Daugherty''' (Thursday, November 8, 1979 – Thursday, February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was [[Torture murder|tortured and murdered]] in [[Greensburg, Pennsylvania]] in February 2010.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>During [[torture]] and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume [[feces]] and [[urine]]&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and [[detergent]]<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</del> beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</del> shaved her head<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</del> painted her face with nail polish<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</del> forced her to write a fake [[suicide note]]<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</del> and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>During [[torture]] and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume [[feces]] and [[urine]]&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and [[detergent]]<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">;</ins> beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">;</ins> shaved her head<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">;</ins> painted her face with nail polish<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">;</ins> forced her to write a fake [[suicide note]]<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">;</ins> and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12 to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman], The Washington Post, February 13, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">-</ins> to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman], The Washington Post, February 13, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Allegheny County Coroner [[Cyril H. Wecht]], who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm How slaying victim came to know her attackers], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Allegheny County Coroner [[Cyril H. Wecht]], who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm How slaying victim came to know her attackers], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 14:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 14:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td href="//www.google.com/images?safe=off&amp;tbm=isch&amp;tbs=sur:fmc&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+-site:wikipedia.org+-site:wikimedia.org">free images</a></span></small></span> <small><i>(February 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Jennifer Lee Daugherty</b> (Thursday, November 8, 1979 – Thursday, February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was <a href="/wiki/Torture_murder" title="Torture murder" class="mw-redirect">tortured and murdered</a> in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg, Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>During <a href="/wiki/Torture" title="Torture">torture</a> and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <a href="/wiki/Feces" title="Feces">feces</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urine" title="Urine">urine</a><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Detergent" title="Detergent">detergent</a>; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake <a href="/wiki/Suicide_note" title="Suicide note">suicide note</a>; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm">6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml">Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers</a>, CBS News, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html">Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman</a>, The Washington Post, February 13, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-5">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm">How slaying victim came to know her attackers</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010</span></li> </ol> </div> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/40px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" width="40" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/60px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 1.5x, id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">Murder of Jennifer Daugherty: Difference between revisions</h1> 						<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content"> 									<div id="siteSub">From Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm How slaying victim came to know her attackers], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 17:49, 14 April 2010</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-style ambox-Orphan" role="presentation" style="display: none"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><a href="/wiki/File:Wiki_letter_w.svg" class="image"><img alt="Wiki letter w.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/6c/Wiki_letter_w.svg/40px-Wiki_letter_w.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/6c/Wiki_letter_w.svg/60px-Wiki_letter_w.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/6c/Wiki_letter_w.svg/80px-Wiki_letter_w.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="44" data-file-height="44" /></a></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">This article <b>is an <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Orphan" title="Wikipedia:Orphan">orphan</a>, as no other articles <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Whatlinkshere&amp;target=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty&amp;namespace=0">link to it</a></b>. Please <a href="/wiki/Help:Link" title="Help:Link">introduce links</a> to this page from <span class="plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&amp;redirs=1&amp;search=Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty&amp;fulltext=Search&amp;ns0=1&amp;title=Special%3ASearch&amp;advanced=1&amp;fulltext=Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty">related articles</a></span>; try the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//edwardbetts.com/find_link?q=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty">Find link tool</a> for suggestions. <small><i>(March 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-content ambox-Notability" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">The topic of this article <b>may not meet Wikipedia's <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Notability_(people)" title="Wikipedia:Notability (people)">notability guideline for biographies</a></b>. <span class="hide-when-compact">Please help to establish notability by adding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">reliable, secondary sources</a> about the topic. If notability cannot be established, the article is likely to be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merge" title="Wikipedia:Merge" class="mw-redirect">merged</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Redirect" title="Wikipedia:Redirect">redirected</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Deletion_policy" title="Wikipedia:Deletion policy">deleted</a>.<br /> <small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;num=50">"Murder of Jennifer Daugherty"</a>&#160;–&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;tbm=nws">news</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">books</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">scholar</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/images?safe=off&amp;tbm=isch&amp;tbs=sur:fmc&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+-site:wikipedia.org+-site:wikimedia.org">free images</a></span></small></span> <small><i>(February 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Jennifer Lee Daugherty</b> (Thursday, November 8, 1979 – Thursday, February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was <a href="/wiki/Torture_murder" title="Torture murder" class="mw-redirect">tortured and murdered</a> in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg, Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>During <a href="/wiki/Torture" title="Torture">torture</a> and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <a href="/wiki/Feces" title="Feces">feces</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urine" title="Urine">urine</a><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Detergent" title="Detergent">detergent</a>; beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch; shaved her head; painted her face with nail polish; forced her to write a fake <a href="/wiki/Suicide_note" title="Suicide note">suicide note</a>; and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12- to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm">6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml">Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers</a>, CBS News, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" <li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-5">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm">How slaying victim came to know her attackers</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010</span></li> </ol> </div> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/40px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" width="40" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/60px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/80px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="300" /></a></td> <td><i>This <a href="/wiki/Crime" title="Crime">crime</a>-related article is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>During [[torture]] and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume [[feces]] and [[urine]]&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and [[detergent]], beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch, shaved her head, painted her face with nail polish, forced her to write a fake [[suicide note]], and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, as of 15:39, 2 April 2010</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-style ambox-Orphan" role="presentation" style="display: none"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><a href="/wiki/File:Wiki_letter_w.svg" class="image"><img alt="Wiki letter w.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/6c/Wiki_letter_w.svg/40px-Wiki_letter_w.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/6c/Wiki_letter_w.svg/60px-Wiki_letter_w.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/6c/Wiki_letter_w.svg/80px-Wiki_letter_w.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="44" data-file-height="44" /></a></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">This article <b>is an <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Orphan" title="Wikipedia:Orphan">orphan</a>, as no other articles <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Whatlinkshere&amp;target=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty&amp;namespace=0">link to it</a></b>. Please <a href="/wiki/Help:Link" title="Help:Link">introduce links</a> to this page from <span class="plainlinks"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&amp;redirs=1&amp;search=Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty&amp;fulltext=Search&amp;ns0=1&amp;title=Special%3ASearch&amp;advanced=1&amp;fulltext=Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty">related articles</a></span>; try the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//edwardbetts.com/find_link?q=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty">Find link tool</a> for suggestions. <small><i>(March 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-content ambox-Notability" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">The topic of this article <b>may not meet Wikipedia's <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Notability_(people)" title="Wikipedia:Notability (people)">notability guideline for biographies</a></b>. <span class="hide-when-compact">Please help to establish notability by adding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">reliable, secondary sources</a> about the topic. If notability cannot be established, the article is likely to be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merge" title="Wikipedia:Merge" class="mw-redirect">merged</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Redirect" title="Wikipedia:Redirect">redirected</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Deletion_policy" title="Wikipedia:Deletion policy">deleted</a>.<br /> <small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;num=50">"Murder of Jennifer Daugherty"</a>&#160;–&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;tbm=nws">news</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">books</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">scholar</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/images?safe=off&amp;tbm=isch&amp;tbs=sur:fmc&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+-site:wikipedia.org+-site:wikimedia.org">free images</a></span></small></span> <small><i>(February 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Jennifer Lee Daugherty</b> (Thursday, November 8, 1979 – Thursday, February 11, 2010) was a 30-year-old woman who was <a href="/wiki/Torture_murder" title="Torture murder" class="mw-redirect">tortured and murdered</a> in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg, Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>During <a href="/wiki/Torture" title="Torture">torture</a> and abuse sessions, which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <a href="/wiki/Feces" title="Feces">feces</a> and <a href="/wiki/Urine" title="Urine">urine</a><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Detergent" title="Detergent">detergent</a>, beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch, shaved her head, painted her face with nail polish, forced her to write a fake <a href="/wiki/Suicide_note" title="Suicide note">suicide note</a>, and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12 to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm">6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml">Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers</a>, CBS News, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html">Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman</a>, The Washington Post, February 13, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-5">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm">How slaying victim came to know her attackers</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010</span></li> </ol> </div> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" It allows adding a reason in the summary.">undo</a>)</span></strong></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle2"><a href="/wiki/User:Studerby" title="User:Studerby" class="mw-userlink">Studerby</a> <span class="mw-usertoollinks">(<a href="/wiki/User_talk:Studerby" title="User talk:Studerby">talk</a> | <a href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/Studerby" title="Special:Contributions/Studerby">contribs</a>)</span> </div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle3"> <span class="comment">(defaultsort)</span></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle5"></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle4"><a href="/w/index.php?title=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty&amp;diff=next&amp;oldid=353004866" title="Murder of Jennifer Daugherty" id="differences-nextlink">Next edit →</a></div></td> 				</tr><tr><td colspan='4' style='text-align: center;' class='diff-multi'>(One intermediate revision by one other user not shown)</td></tr><tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 2:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 2:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{notability|Biographies|date=February 2010}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{notability|Biographies|date=February 2010}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>'''Jennifer Daugherty''' was a 30-year-old woman who was tortured and <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">'''</del>murdered<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">'''</del> in [[Greensburg, Pennsylvania]] in February 2010.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Jennifer Daugherty''' was a 30-year-old woman who was <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Torture murder|</ins>tortured and murdered<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</ins> in [[Greensburg, Pennsylvania]] in February 2010.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime], The New York Times, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>During torture and abuse sessions which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume feces and urine&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and detergent, beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch, shaved her head, painted her face with nail polish, forced her to write a fake suicide note, and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>During <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[</ins>torture<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</ins> and abuse sessions<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</ins> which lasted for a total of more than two days, Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[</ins>feces<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</ins> and <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[</ins>urine<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</ins>&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10063/1040265-100.stm 6 held for trial in Greensburg torture, slaying], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, March 4, 2010&lt;/ref&gt; and <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[</ins>detergent<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</ins>, beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch, shaved her head, painted her face with nail polish, forced her to write a fake <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[</ins>suicide note<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]]</ins>, and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers], CBS News, February 16, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12 to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman], The Washington Post, February 13, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>According to her relatives, Daugherty had the mental abilities of a 12 to 14-year-old, she trusted everyone, and she had thought that the suspects were her "friends."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/12/AR2010021201815.html Pa. family: 'Friends' torture, kill disabled woman], The Washington Post, February 13, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Allegheny County Coroner [[Cyril H. You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm How slaying victim came to know her attackers], Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Allegheny County Coroner [[Cyril H. February 14, 2010&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div><del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Category</del>:<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Murder]]</del></div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div><ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">{{DEFAULTSORT</ins>:<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Daugherty, Jennifer}}</ins></div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[Category:Murders]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[Category:2010 deaths]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td
