class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>{{crime-stub}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 04:24, 17 February 2010</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-delete" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-empty-cell"></td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span"><b>This article is being considered for deletion in accordance with Wikipedia's <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Deletion_policy" title="Wikipedia:Deletion policy">deletion policy</a>.</b><br /> Please share your thoughts on the matter at <b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty" title="Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Murder of Jennifer Daugherty">this article's entry</a></b> on the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion" title="Wikipedia:Articles for deletion">Articles for deletion</a> page.<br /> Feel free to edit the article, but the article <b>must not</b> be blanked, and this notice <b>must not</b> be removed, until the discussion is closed. For more information, particularly on merging or moving the article during the discussion, read the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Guide_to_deletion" title="Wikipedia:Guide to deletion">guide to deletion</a>.<span id="delete-reason" style="display:none;">%5B%5BWikipedia%3AArticles+for+deletion%2FMurder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%5D%5D</span><span id="delete-criterion" style="display:none;">AFD</span></span></td> </tr> </table> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-content ambox-Notability" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">The topic of this article <b>may not meet Wikipedia's <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Notability_(people)" title="Wikipedia:Notability (people)">notability guideline for biographies</a></b>. <span class="hide-when-compact">Please help to establish notability by adding <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Identifying_reliable_sources" title="Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources">reliable, secondary sources</a> about the topic. If notability cannot be established, the article is likely to be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merge" title="Wikipedia:Merge" class="mw-redirect">merged</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Redirect" title="Wikipedia:Redirect">redirected</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Deletion_policy" title="Wikipedia:Deletion policy">deleted</a>.<br /> <small><span class="plainlinks"><i>Find sources:</i>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?as_eq=wikipedia&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;num=50">"Murder of Jennifer Daugherty"</a>&#160;–&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;tbm=nws">news</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+site:news.google.com/newspapers&amp;source=newspapers">newspapers</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/search?tbs=bks:1&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">books</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22">scholar</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22&amp;acc=on&amp;wc=on">JSTOR</a>&#160;<b>·</b> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.google.com/images?safe=off&amp;tbm=isch&amp;tbs=sur:fmc&amp;q=%22Murder+of+Jennifer+Daugherty%22+-site:wikipedia.org+-site:wikimedia.org">free images</a></span></small></span> <small><i>(February 2010)</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Jennifer Daugherty</b> was a 30 year old woman who was tortured and <b>murdered</b> in <a href="/wiki/Greensburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Greensburg, Pennsylvania">Greensburg, Pennsylvania</a> in February 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Allegheny County Coroner <a href="/wiki/Cyril_H._Wecht" title="Cyril H. Wecht" class="mw-redirect">Cyril H. Wecht</a>, who has conducted and reviewed thousands of autopsies of homicide victims, stated, "... This is one of the most horrific cases I have seen... You have one young, defenseless woman, six people who are keeping her captive and doing all of these things, knowing she is [mentally challenged]. Put it all together, it is bizarre, it is extreme barbarism."<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Daugherty's attackers tied her up, forced her to consume detergent and urine, beat her with a towel rack, a vacuum cleaner hose, and a crutch, shaved her head, painted her face with nail polish, forced her to write a fake suicide note, and then stabbed her to death. Six suspects were charged with criminal homicide, kidnapping and other counts related to her death.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/02/16/us/AP-US-Disabled-Woman-Torture.html">Feds: Pa. Torture Death Might Be Hate Crime</a>, The New York Times, February 16, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10045/1035865-59.stm">How slaying victim came to know her attackers</a>, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, February 14, 2010</span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/02/16/crimesider/entry6212578.shtml">Jennifer Daugherty, Mentally Disabled Woman, Trusted Everyone, Including Her Killers</a>, CBS News, February 16, 2010</span></li> </ol> </div> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/40px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg" width="40" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/60px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg/80px-Standard_legirons_taiwan01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="300" /></a></td> <td><i>This <a href="/wiki/Crime" title="Crime">crime</a>-related article is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Murder_of_Jennifer_Daugherty&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini" style="position: absolute; right: 15px; display: none;"> <ul> <li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Crime-stub" title="Template:Crime-stub"><span title="View this template">v</span></a></li> <li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Crime-stub" title="Template talk:Crime-stub"><span title="Discuss this template">t</span></a></li> <li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Crime-stub&amp;action=edit"><span title="Edit this template">e</span></a></li> </ul> </div> </td> </tr> </table>   <!--  NewPP colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (October 15, 1978 – February 9, 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td football)|forward]].</del></div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div><ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">==Playing</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">career==</ins></div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"></td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td> </tr> <tr>   <td His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] for Eastleigh Social Club in the [[Carlsberg]] Pub Cup Final, held on 6th May 2000.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.|Cowes Sports]], [[Christchurch F.C.|Christchurch]], [[Brading Town F.C.|Brading Town]],[[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] and West Moors F.C. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] for Eastleigh Social Club in the [[Carlsberg]] Pub Cup Final, held on 6th May 2000.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Oliveira]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Oliveira]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 17:17, 5 February 2010</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; text-align: left; font-size: 88%; line-height: 1.5em; † Appearances (Goals).<br /></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (October 15, 1978 – February 9, 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Playing_career">Playing career</span></h2> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a>,<a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> and West Moors F.C. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/wiki/Old_Wembley_Stadium" title="Old Wembley Stadium" class="mw-redirect">Old Wembley Stadium</a> for Eastleigh Social Club in the <a href="/wiki/Carlsberg" title="Carlsberg" class="mw-disambig">Carlsberg</a> Pub Cup Final, held on 6th May 2000.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_Oliveira" title="Ricardo Oliveira">Ricardo Oliveira</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30,<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template"><span style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Link_rot" title="Wikipedia:Link rot"><span title="&#160;since June 2009">dead link</span></a></i>]</span></sup></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">"Tragic death of non-league striker"</a>. Dailyecho.co.uk. 2009-02-10<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMarc+Burrows&amp;rft.btitle=Tragic+death+of+non-league+striker&amp;rft.date=2009-02-10&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.dailyecho.co.uk%2Fsearch%2F4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker%2F&amp;rft.pub=Dailyecho.co.uk&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation news"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm">"Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal"</a>. BBC News. 2004-04-07<span class="reference-accessdate">. title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMarc+Burrows&amp;rft.btitle=Fastest+football+goal+scorer+dies&amp;rft.date=2009-02-14&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fengland%2F7890299.stm&amp;rft.pub=BBC+News&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.|Cowes Sports]], [[Christchurch F.C.|Christchurch]], [[Brading Town F.C.|Brading Town]] and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">in</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">a</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">nationwide</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Sunday</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">League</del> Cup <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">final</del>.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.|Cowes Sports]], [[Christchurch F.C.|Christchurch]], [[Brading Town F.C.|Brading Town<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">]],[[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh</ins>]] and West Moors<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> F.C</ins>. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">for</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Eastleigh</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Social</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Club</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">in the [[Carlsberg]] Pub</ins> Cup <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Final, held on 6th May 2000</ins>.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Oliveira]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Oliveira]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">.</del>&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</ins>&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 20:31, 16 September 2009</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">West Moors</td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only. † Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a>,<a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> and West Moors F.C. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/wiki/Old_Wembley_Stadium" title="Old Wembley Stadium" class="mw-redirect">Old Wembley Stadium</a> for Eastleigh Social Club in the <a href="/wiki/Carlsberg" title="Carlsberg" class="mw-disambig">Carlsberg</a> Pub Cup Final, held on 6th May 2000.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_Oliveira" title="Ricardo Oliveira">Ricardo Oliveira</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30,<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template"><span style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Link_rot" title="Wikipedia:Link rot"><span title="&#160;since June 2009">dead link</span></a></i>]</span></sup></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">"Tragic death of non-league striker"</a>. Dailyecho.co.uk. 2009-02-10<span class="reference-accessdate">.   <td class="diff-context"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.|Cowes Sports]], [[Christchurch F.C.|Christchurch]], [[Brading Town F.C.|Brading Town]] and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">a</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">nationwide</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Sunday League</del> Cup <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">final</del>.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.|Cowes Sports]], [[Christchurch F.C.|Christchurch]], [[Brading Town F.C.|Brading Town]] and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">the</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Calsberg]]</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Pub</ins> Cup <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Final, held on 6th May 2000</ins>.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Olivera</del>]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Oliveira</ins>]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 09:44, 7 September 2009</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Years</th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><b>Team</b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">West Moors</td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only. † Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a> and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/wiki/Old_Wembley_Stadium" title="Old Wembley Stadium" class="mw-redirect">Old Wembley Stadium</a> in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Calsberg&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Calsberg (page does not exist)">Calsberg</a> Pub Cup Final, held on 6th May 2000.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_Oliveira" title="Ricardo Oliveira">Ricardo Oliveira</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template"><span style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Link_rot" title="Wikipedia:Link rot"><span title="&#160;since June 2009">dead link</span></a></i>]</span></sup></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">"Tragic death of non-league striker"</a>. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.|Cowes Sports]], [[Christchurch F.C.|Christchurch]], [[Brading Town F.C.|Brading Town]] and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Olivera</del>]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Oliveira</ins>]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against [[Eastleigh F.C.|Eastleigh]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 42:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 42:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Cancer deaths in England]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Cancer deaths in England]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[Category:Cowes Sports F.C. players]]</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 00:54, 2 September 2009</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; text-align: left; font-size: 88%; line-height: 1.5em; line-height: 1.2em"> <caption class="fn" style="font-size:125%; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em; text-align: center;">Marc Burrows</caption> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Personal information</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Playing position</th> <td colspan="3" class="role" style="white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5em">Youth career</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td colspan="3" class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Senior career*</th> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Years</th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><b>Team</b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"><b>Apps<sup>†</sup></b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"><b>(Gls)<sup>†</sup></b></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">West Moors</td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only. † Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a> and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/wiki/Old_Wembley_Stadium" title="Old Wembley Stadium" class="mw-redirect">Old Wembley Stadium</a> in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_Oliveira" title="Ricardo Oliveira">Ricardo Oliveira</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template"><span style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Link_rot" title="Wikipedia:Link rot"><span title="&#160;since June 2009">dead link</span></a></i>]</span></sup></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">"Tragic death of non-league striker"</a>. BBC News. 2004-04-07<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMarc+Burrows&amp;rft.btitle=Footballer%27s+%27fastest+ever%27+goal&amp;rft.date=2004-04-07&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fengland%2Fhampshire%2Fdorset%2F3606977.stm&amp;rft.pub=BBC+News&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation news"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm">"Fastest football goal scorer dies"</a>. BBC News. 2009-02-14<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span </div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 26:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 25:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.]], [[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> F.C</del>. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Cowes Sports</ins>]], [[Christchurch F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Christchurch</ins>]], [[Brading Town F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Brading Town</ins>]] and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> reserve team</ins> match against [[Eastleigh F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Eastleigh</ins>]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Burrows died<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">, aged 30,</del> on 9 February 2009,&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009,<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> aged 30.</ins>&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 43:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 42:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Cancer deaths in England]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Cancer deaths in England]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[Category:Cowes Sports F.C. players]]</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 06:05, 11 July 2009</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; text-align: left; font-size: 88%; line-height: 1.5em; line-height: 1.2em"> <caption class="fn" style="font-size:125%; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em; text-align: center;">Marc Burrows</caption> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Personal information</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Playing position</th> <td colspan="3" class="role" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Senior career*</th> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Years</th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><b>Team</b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"><b>Apps<sup>†</sup></b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"><b>(Gls)<sup>†</sup></b></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">West Moors</td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only. † Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a> and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/wiki/Old_Wembley_Stadium" title="Old Wembley Stadium" class="mw-redirect">Old Wembley Stadium</a> in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template"><span style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Link_rot" title="Wikipedia:Link rot"><span title="&#160;since June 2009">dead link</span></a></i>]</span></sup></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">"Tragic death of non-league striker"</a>. BBC News. 2004-04-07<span class="reference-accessdate">. BBC News. 2009-02-14<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span <td class="diff-addedline"><div>| clubs4               = West Moors</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>| totalcaps(goals)     = </div></td> nationalyears1       = </div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>| nationalyears1       = </div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 26:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 25:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.]], [[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> F.C</del>. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Cowes Sports</ins>]], [[Christchurch F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Christchurch</ins>]], [[Brading Town F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Brading Town</ins>]] and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> reserve team</ins> match against [[Eastleigh F.C.<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">|Eastleigh</ins>]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]{{dead link|date=June 2009}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Burrows died<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">, aged 30,</del> on 9 February 2009,&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows died on 9 February 2009,<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> aged 30.</ins>&lt;ref&gt;{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ |title=Tragic death of non-league striker |publisher=Dailyecho.co.uk |date=2009-02-10 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt; after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm |title=Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal |publisher=BBC News |date=2004-04-07 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;&lt;ref&gt;{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm |title=Fastest football goal scorer dies |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-02-14 |accessdate=2009-06-09}}&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>==References==</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 15:22, 24 June 2009</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; text-align: left; font-size: 88%; line-height: 1.5em; line-height: 1.2em"> <caption class="fn" style="font-size:125%; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em; text-align: center;">Marc Burrows</caption> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Personal information</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Playing position</th> <td colspan="3" class="role" style="white-space: nowrap;
