line-height: 1.5em">Youth career</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td colspan="3" class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Senior career*</th> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Years</th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><b>Team</b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"><b>Apps<sup>†</sup></b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"><b>(Gls)<sup>†</sup></b></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">West Moors</td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only. † Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town</a> and West Moors. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/wiki/Old_Wembley_Stadium" title="Old Wembley Stadium" class="mw-redirect">Old Wembley Stadium</a> in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a reserve team match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died on 9 February 2009, aged 30.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template"><span style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Link_rot" title="Wikipedia:Link rot"><span title="&#160;since June 2009">dead link</span></a></i>]</span></sup></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">"Tragic death of non-league striker"</a>. Dailyecho.co.uk. 2009-02-10<span class="reference-accessdate">. BBC News. 2004-04-07<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMarc+Burrows&amp;rft.btitle=Footballer%27s+%27fastest+ever%27+goal&amp;rft.date=2004-04-07&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fengland%2Fhampshire%2Fdorset%2F3606977.stm&amp;rft.pub=BBC+News&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation news"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm">"Fastest football goal scorer dies"</a>. BBC News. 2009-02-14<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMarc+Burrows&amp;rft.btitle=Fastest+football+goal+scorer+dies&amp;rft.date=2009-02-14&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fengland%2F7890299.stm&amp;rft.pub=BBC+News&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</del> [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> </ins>[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">. His playing career included appearances in the [[FA Cup]], [[FA Vase]] and an appearance at the [[Old Wembley Stadium]] in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final</ins>.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div><del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), </del>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A class="diff-empty">&#160;</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>{{England-footy-striker-1970s-stub}}</div></td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 04:55, 16 June 2009</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; text-align: left; font-size: 88%; line-height: 1.5em; line-height: 1.2em"> <caption class="fn" style="font-size:125%; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em; text-align: center;">Marc Burrows</caption> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Personal information</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">West Moors F.C.</td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only. † Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a> and West Moors F.C. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/wiki/Old_Wembley_Stadium" title="Old Wembley Stadium" class="mw-redirect">Old Wembley Stadium</a> in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died, aged 30, on 9 February 2009,<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template"><span style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Link_rot" title="Wikipedia:Link rot"><span title="&#160;since June 2009">dead link</span></a></i>]</span></sup></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">"Tragic death of non-league striker"</a>. Dailyecho.co.uk. 2009-02-10<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMarc+Burrows&amp;rft.btitle=Tragic+death+of+non-league+striker&amp;rft.date=2009-02-10&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.dailyecho.co.uk%2Fsearch%2F4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker%2F&amp;rft.pub=Dailyecho.co.uk&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="citation news"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm">"Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal"</a>. BBC News. 2004-04-07<span class="reference-accessdate">. BBC News. 2009-02-14<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2009-06-09</span></span>.</span><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMarc+Burrows&amp;rft.btitle=Fastest+football+goal+scorer+dies&amp;rft.date=2009-02-14&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fhi%2Fengland%2F7890299.stm&amp;rft.pub=BBC+News&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div><del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Although</del> his<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> playing</del> career <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">was</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">not</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">notable</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">(appearances</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">in</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">F.A.</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Cup,</del> F.<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">A</del>.<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final)</del>, Burrows <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">is</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">recognised</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">of</del> [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Colin</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Cowperthwaite</del>]]<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by</del> [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Ricardo</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Olivera</del>]]<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against</del> [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Eastleigh</del> F.C.]]<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line</del> and <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">shot</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">straight</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">from kick-off</del>. <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">With</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">the</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">wind</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">behind</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">it the ball landed</del> in the <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">goal</del>, <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">and</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">was</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">recorded</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">by</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">the match referee</del> at <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">2.0 seconds. The</del> [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Football</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Association</del>]] <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">later confirmed this goal was</del> a <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">world</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">record</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">for</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">the</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">sport</del>.<del class="diffchange F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></i> and <i><strong class="selflink">Talk:Marc Burrows#Merge article</strong></i>. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Talk:Cowes Sports F.C.">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since March 2009.</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; text-align: left; font-size: 88%; line-height: 1.5em; line-height: 1.2em"> <caption class="fn" style="font-size:125%; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em; text-align: center;">Marc Burrows</caption> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Personal information</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Playing position</th> <td colspan="3" class="role" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">Forward</a></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Youth career</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"></th> <td colspan="3" class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Senior career*</th> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Years</th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><b>Team</b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"><b>Apps<sup>†</sup></b></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"><b>(Gls)<sup>†</sup></b></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="font-weight:normal">–</span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">West Moors F.C.</td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only. † Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a> and West Moors F.C. His playing career included appearances in the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FA_Vase" title="FA Vase">FA Vase</a> and an appearance at the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Old_Wembley_stadium&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Old Wembley stadium (page does not exist)">old Wembley stadium</a> in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final.</p> <p>Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died, aged 30, on 9 February 2009,<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">Tragic death of non-league striker</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm">Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 1:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 1:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Mergeto|Cowes article|date=March 2009}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">&amp;ndash;</del> 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Marc "Buzz" Burrows''' (15 October 1978 <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">–</ins> 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">apprentiship</del> at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs, [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">apprenticeship</ins> at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs, [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 17:27, 1 May 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/50px-Merge-arrow.svg.png" width="50" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/75px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/100px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="50" data-file-height="20" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">It has been suggested that this article be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merging" title="Wikipedia:Merging">merged</a> into <i><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></i> and <i><strong class="selflink">Talk:Marc Burrows#Merge article</strong></i>. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Talk:Cowes Sports F.C.">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since March 2009.</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs, <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a>,<a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a> and West Moors F.C.</p> <p>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>, after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" clubs, [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career on a two year <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">apprenticeship</ins> at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs, [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 16:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 16:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:English footballers]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:English footballers]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>[[Category:<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Deaths</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">from</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">cancer</del>]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[Category:<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Cancer</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">deaths</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">in England</ins>]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 01:02, 26 April 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/50px-Merge-arrow.svg.png" width="50" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/75px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/100px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="50" data-file-height="20" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">It has been suggested that this article be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merging" title="Wikipedia:Merging">merged</a> into <i><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></i> and <i><strong class="selflink">Talk:Marc Burrows#Merge article</strong></i>. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Talk:Cowes Sports F.C.">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since March 2009.</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 - 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprenticeship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs, <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a>,<a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a> and West Moors F.C.</p> <p>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>, after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">Tragic death of non-league striker</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm">Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm">Fastest football goal scorer dies</a></span></li> </ol> </div> <p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:England-footy-striker-1970s-stub&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:England-footy-striker-1970s-stub (page does not id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">Marc Burrows: Difference between revisions</h1> 						<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content"> 									<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 16:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 16:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:English footballers]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:English footballers]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:Football (soccer) forwards]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>[[Category:<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Deaths</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">from</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">cancer</del>]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[Category:<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Cancer</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">deaths</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">in the Unitd Kingdom</ins>]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>{{England-footy-<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">bio</del>-stub}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>{{England-footy-<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">striker-1970s</ins>-stub}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 17:10, 3 April 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/50px-Merge-arrow.svg.png" width="50" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/75px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/100px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="50" data-file-height="20" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">It has been suggested that this article be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merging" title="Wikipedia:Merging">merged</a> into <i><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></i> and <i><strong class="selflink">Talk:Marc Burrows#Merge article</strong></i>. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Talk:Cowes Sports F.C.">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since March 2009.</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprentiship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs, <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a>,<a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a> and West Moors F.C.</p> <p>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>, after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">Tragic death of non-league striker</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm">Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">Marc Burrows: Difference between revisions</h1> 						<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content"> 									<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the href="/wiki/Special:Contributions/195.195.236.65" title="Special:Contributions/195.195.236.65" class="mw-userlink mw-anonuserlink">195.195.236.65</a> <span class="mw-usertoollinks">(<a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Stub_sorting" title="Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting">You can help!</a>)</span></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle5"></div><div id="mw-diff-ntitle4"><a </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprentiship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs, [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C.</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>After beginning his career on a two year apprentiship at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs, [[Cowes Sports F.C.]],[[Christchurch F.C.]], [[Brading Town F.C.]] and West Moors F.C.</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> final</ins>), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ Tragic death of non-league striker]&lt;/ref&gt;, after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal]&lt;/ref&gt; &lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm Fastest football goal scorer dies] &lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ Tragic death of non-league striker]&lt;/ref&gt;, after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal]&lt;/ref&gt; &lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm Fastest football goal scorer dies] &lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 19:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 19:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>{{England-footy-<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">bio</del>-stub}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>{{England-footy-<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">striker-1970s</ins>-stub}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 10:28, 27 March 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/50px-Merge-arrow.svg.png" width="50" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/75px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/100px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="50" data-file-height="20" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">It has been suggested that this article be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merging" title="Wikipedia:Merging">merged</a> into <i><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></i> and <i><strong class="selflink">Talk:Marc Burrows#Merge article</strong></i>. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Talk:Cowes Sports F.C.">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since March 2009.</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprentiship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs, <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a>,<a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a> and West Moors F.C.</p> <p>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>, after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm">A goal after two seconds</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/">Tragic death of non-league striker</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm">Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm">Fastest football goal scorer dies</a></span></li> </ol> </div> <p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:England-footy-striker-1970s-stub&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:England-footy-striker-1970s-stub (page does not 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>After beginning his career <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">as</del> a <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">trainee</del> at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.]] <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">and</del> [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Christchurch</del> F.C.]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>After beginning his career <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">on</ins> a <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">two year apprentiship</ins> at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,</ins> [[Cowes Sports F.C.]]<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">,[[Christchurch</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">F.C.]],</ins> [[<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Brading Town</ins> F.C.]]<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> and West Moors F.C.</ins></div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>Although his playing career was not notable, Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>Although his playing career was not notable<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final)</ins>, Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of [[Colin Cowperthwaite]] (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by [[Ricardo Olivera]] (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against [[Eastleigh F.C.]] in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The [[Football Association]] later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.thefa.com/GrassrootsOld/GrassRootsNews/Postings/2004/04/A_goal_after_two_seconds.htm A goal after two seconds]&lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ Tragic death of non-league striker]&lt;/ref&gt;, after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal]&lt;/ref&gt; &lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm Fastest football goal scorer dies] &lt;/ref&gt;</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009&lt;ref&gt;[http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/search/4113831.Tragic_death_of_non_league_striker/ Tragic death of non-league striker]&lt;/ref&gt;, after being diagnosed with cancer.&lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal]&lt;/ref&gt; &lt;ref&gt;[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/7890299.stm Fastest football goal scorer dies] &lt;/ref&gt;</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 08:59, 21 March 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/50px-Merge-arrow.svg.png" width="50" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/75px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/100px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="50" data-file-height="20" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">It has been suggested that this article be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merging" title="Wikipedia:Merging">merged</a> into <i><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></i> and <i><strong class="selflink">Talk:Marc Burrows#Merge article</strong></i>. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Talk:Cowes Sports F.C.">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since March 2009.</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc "Buzz" Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career on a two year apprentiship at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs, <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a>,<a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brading_Town_F.C." title="Brading Town F.C.">Brading Town F.C.</a> and West Moors F.C.</p> <p>Although his playing career was not notable (appearances in F.A. Cup, F.A. Vase Cup and appeared at the old Wembley stadium in a nationwide Sunday League Cup final), Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>, after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Marc Burrows''' (<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">15 October </ins>1978 &amp;ndash; 9 February 2009) was an [[England|English]] [[association football]] player, who played as a [[forward (association football)|forward]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>After beginning his career as a trainee at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.]] and [[Christchurch F.C.]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>After beginning his career as a trainee at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], Burrows played for non-league clubs [[Cowes Sports F.C.]] and [[Christchurch F.C.]]</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 21:36, 19 March 2009</h2> <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation"> <tr> <td class="mbox-image"> <div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/50px-Merge-arrow.svg.png" width="50" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/75px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Merge-arrow.svg/100px-Merge-arrow.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="50" data-file-height="20" /></div> </td> <td class="mbox-text"><span class="mbox-text-span">It has been suggested that this article be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merging" title="Wikipedia:Merging">merged</a> into <i><a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a></i> and <i><strong class="selflink">Talk:Marc Burrows#Merge article</strong></i>. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Talk:Cowes Sports F.C.">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since March 2009.</i></small></span></td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Marc Burrows</b> (15 October 1978 – 9 February 2009) was an <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">English</a> <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> player, who played as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a>.</p> <p>After beginning his career as a trainee at <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, Burrows played for non-league clubs <a href="/wiki/Cowes_Sports_F.C." title="Cowes Sports F.C.">Cowes Sports F.C.</a> and <a href="/wiki/Christchurch_F.C." title="Christchurch F.C.">Christchurch F.C.</a></p> <p>Although his playing career was not notable, Burrows is recognised as scoring the sport's fastest ever goal, beating both the former English record of <a href="/wiki/Colin_Cowperthwaite" title="Colin Cowperthwaite">Colin Cowperthwaite</a> (3.5 seconds) and the world record held by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ricardo_Olivera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ricardo Olivera (page does not exist)">Ricardo Olivera</a> (2.8 seconds). The record was set in a match against <a href="/wiki/Eastleigh_F.C." title="Eastleigh F.C.">Eastleigh F.C.</a> in 2004, when Burrows spotted the goalkeeper off his line and shot straight from kick-off. With the wind behind it the ball landed in the goal, and was recorded by the match referee at 2.0 seconds. The <a href="/wiki/Football_Association" title="Football Association" class="mw-redirect">Football Association</a> later confirmed this goal was a world record for the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <p>Burrows died aged 30 on 9 February 2009<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup>, after being diagnosed with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup></p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2> <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> <ol class="references"> <li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/hampshire/dorset/3606977.stm">Footballer's 'fastest ever' goal</a></span></li> <li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-4">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text"
