background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">National team<sup>‡</sup></th> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"><span style="line-height:1.7em"><span style="font-weight:normal">2005-2006</span></span></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><span style="line-height:1.7em"><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland"><img alt="Poland" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/23px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/35px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/46px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="800" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland</a></span></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;"><span style="line-height:1.7em">3 (0)</span></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only and correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC).<br /> <p>† Appearances (Goals).<br /></p> ‡ National team caps and goals correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for Bnei Sakhnin,loaned from M. Haifa. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" Appearances (Goals).<br /></p> ‡ National team caps and goals correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland"><img alt="Poland" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/23px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png" width="23" height="14" appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only and correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC).<br /> <p>† Appearances (Goals).<br /></p> ‡ National team caps and goals correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>'''Łukasz Surma''' (born on [[June 28]] , [[1977]] in [[Kraków]]) is a [[Poland|Polish]] footballer ([[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> </del>defensive midfielder]]) playing currently for [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Legia</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Warszawa</del>]]. He <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">is</del> a captain of <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">this</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">team</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">(in</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">2006</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">he</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">won</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">with</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Legia</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Warszawa]]</del> Polish Championship<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">)</del>. In the past years he played for clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Surma also played for the [[Poland national football team]]. On [[July 5]], [[2007]] Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]].</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Łukasz Surma''' (born on [[June 28]] , [[1977]] in [[Kraków]]) is a [[Poland|Polish]] footballer ([[defensive midfielder]]) playing currently for [[<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Maccabi</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa</ins>]]. He <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">was</ins> a captain of <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Legia</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Warszawa]]</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">for</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">4</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">years.</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">With</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">this</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">team</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">he won</ins> Polish Championship<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> in 2006</ins>. In the past years he played for clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Surma also played for the [[Poland national football team]]. On [[July 5]], [[2007]] Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Maccabi Haifa F.C. squad}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Maccabi Haifa F.C. squad}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 11:19, 18 July 2007</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; vertical-align: baseline;"><span style="line-height:1.7em">50 (1)<br /> 117 (6)<br /> 123 (8)<br /> 0 (0)</span></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">National team<sup>‡</sup></th> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><span style="line-height:1.7em"><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland"><img alt="Poland" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/23px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/35px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/46px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="800" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland</a></span></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only and correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC).<br /> <p>† Appearances (Goals).<br /></p> ‡ National team caps and goals correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" class="diff-context"><div>}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">−</td>   <td class="diff-deletedline"><div>'''Łukasz Surma''' (born on [[June 28]] , [[1977]] in [[Kraków]]) is a [[Poland|Polish]] footballer ([[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> </del>defensive midfielder]]) playing currently for [[<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Legia</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Warszawa</del>]]. He <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">is</del> a captain of <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">this</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">team</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">(in</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">2006</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">he</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">won</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">with</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Legia</del> <del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Warszawa]]</del> Polish Championship<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline">)</del>. In the past years he played for clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Surma also played for the [[Poland national football team]]. On [[July 5]], [[2007]] Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]].</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Łukasz Surma''' (born on [[June 28]] , [[1977]] in [[Kraków]]) is a [[Poland|Polish]] footballer ([[defensive midfielder]]) playing currently for [[<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Maccabi</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa</ins>]]. He <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">was</ins> a captain of <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">[[Legia</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">Warszawa]]</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">for</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">4</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">years.</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">With</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">this</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">team</ins> <ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline">he won</ins> Polish Championship<ins class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> in 2006</ins>. In the past years he played for clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Surma also played for the [[Poland national football team]]. On [[July 5]], [[2007]] Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Maccabi Haifa F.C. squad}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Maccabi Haifa F.C. squad}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 16:49, 13 July 2007</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; vertical-align: baseline;"><span style="line-height:1.7em">50 (1)<br /> 117 (6)<br /> 123 (8)<br /> 0 (0)</span></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">National team<sup>‡</sup></th> </tr> <tr class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"></th> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><span style="line-height:1.7em"><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland"><img alt="Poland" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/23px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/35px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/46px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="800" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland</a></span></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only and correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC).<br /> <p>† Appearances (Goals).<br /></p> ‡ National team caps and goals correct as of 00:49, 9 July 2007 (UTC)</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>. He was a captain of <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> for 4 years. With this team he won Polish Championship in 2006. In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" He is a captain of this team (in 2006 he won with [[Legia Warszawa]] Polish Championship). In the past years he played for clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Surma also played for the [[Poland national football team]]. On [[July 5]], [[2007]] Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa FC]].</del></div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div><ins class="diffchange <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Łukasz Surma''' (born on [[June 28]] , [[1977]] in [[Kraków]]) is a [[Poland|Polish]] footballer ([[ defensive midfielder]]) playing currently for [[Legia Warszawa]]. He is a captain of this team (in 2006 he won with [[Legia Warszawa]] Polish Championship). In the past years he played for clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Surma also played for the [[Poland national football team]]. On [[July 5]], [[2007]] Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td vertical-align: baseline"><span style="line-height:1.7em"><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland"><img alt="Poland" href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland</a></span></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline;text-align: right"></td> <td class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: right"></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <td colspan="4" class="" style="text-align:center; color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">† Appearances (Goals).</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer ( <a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a>. He is a captain of this team (in 2006 he won with <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> Polish Championship). In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" ([[ defensive midfielder]]) playing currently for [[Legia Warszawa]]. He is a captain of this team (in 2006 he won with [[Legia Warszawa]] Polish Championship). In the past years he played for clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Surma also played for the [[Poland national football team]]. On [[July 5]], [[2007]] Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td Surma]]</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 02:38, 8 July 2007</h2> <table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="5" style="width: 22em; text-align: left; font-size: 88%; line-height: 1.5em; line-height: 1.2em"> <caption class="fn" style="font-size:125%; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.5em; text-align: center;">Łukasz Surma</caption> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Personal information</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Playing position</th> <td colspan="3" class="role" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><a href="/wiki/Midfielder" title="Midfielder">Midfielder</a></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; background-color: #b0c4de; line-height: 1.5em">Club information</th> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left"> <div style="padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">Current team</div> </th> <td colspan="3" class="org" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline"><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Israel" title="Israel"><img alt="Israel" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/21px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png" width="21" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/32px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/41px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="660" data-file-height="480" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a></td> </tr> <tr class=""> <th style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline; text-align: left">Number</th> <td colspan="3" class="" style="white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">5</td> </tr> </table> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer ( <a href="/wiki/Defensive_midfielder" title="Defensive midfielder" class="mw-redirect">defensive midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a>. He is a captain of this team (in 2006 he won with <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a> Polish Championship). In the past years he played for clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Surma also played for the <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a>. On <a href="/wiki/July_5" title="July 5">July 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007">2007</a> Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_F.C." title="Maccabi Haifa F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner"   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[pl:Łukasz Surma]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[pl:Łukasz Surma]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[he:לוקאס סורמה]]</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 00:41, 7 July 2007</h2> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Midfielder" title="Midfielder">midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a>. He is a captain of this team . In the past years he played for such a clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Łukasz Surma played also for <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a> . in 5.7.2007 Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_FC" title="Maccabi Haifa FC" class="mw-redirect">Maccabi Haifa FC</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"> <tr> <th scope="col" class="navbox-title" colspan="2" He is a captain of this team . In the past years he played for such a clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Łukasz Surma played also for [[Poland national football team]] .<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> </del></div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Łukasz Surma''' (born on [[June 28]] , [[1977]] in [[Kraków]]) is a [[Poland|Polish]] footballer ([[midfielder]]) playing currently for [[Legia Warszawa]]. He is a captain of this team . In the past years he played for such a clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Łukasz Surma played also for [[Poland national football team]] .</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>in 5.7.2007 Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa FC]].</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Legia Warszawa squad}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Legia Warszawa squad}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 13:</td>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-lineno">Line 13:</td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[pl:Łukasz Surma]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[pl:Łukasz Surma]]</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>[[he:לוקאס סורמה]]</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 08:44, 6 July 2007</h2> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Midfielder" title="Midfielder">midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a>. He is a captain of this team . In the past years he played for such a clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Łukasz Surma played also for <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a> . in 5.7.2007 Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_FC" title="Maccabi Haifa FC" class="mw-redirect">Maccabi Haifa FC</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="nowraplinks vcard collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"> <tr> <th scope="col" class="navbox-title" colspan="2" style="background:green; color:white; border:1px solid black; width:87%;"> <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini"> <ul> <li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Legia_Warsaw_squad" title="Template:Legia Warsaw squad"><span title="View this template" style=";background:green; color:white; border:1px solid black; width:87%;;background:none transparent;border:none;">v</span></a></li> <li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Legia_Warsaw_squad" title="Template talk:Legia Warsaw squad"><span title="Discuss this template" style=";background:green; color:white; border:1px solid black; width:87%;;background:none transparent;border:none;">t</span></a></li> <li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Legia_Warsaw_squad&amp;action=edit"><span title="Edit this template" style=";background:green; color:white; border:1px solid black; width:87%;;background:none transparent;border:none;">e</span></a></li> </ul> </div> <div class="fn org" style="font-size:110%"><a href="/wiki/Legia_Warsaw" title="Legia Warsaw"><span style="color: He is a captain of this team . In the past years he played for such a clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Łukasz Surma played also for [[Poland national football team]] .<del class="diffchange diffchange-inline"> </del></div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>'''Łukasz Surma''' (born on [[June 28]] , [[1977]] in [[Kraków]]) is a [[Poland|Polish]] footballer ([[midfielder]]) playing currently for [[Legia Warszawa]]. He is a captain of this team . In the past years he played for such a clubs like [[Ruch Chorzów]] (1998-2002) and [[Wisła Kraków]] (1996-1998). Łukasz Surma played also for [[Poland national football team]] .</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>in 5.7.2007 Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side [[Maccabi Haifa FC]]. </div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Legia Warszawa squad}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{Legia Warszawa squad}}</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 22:36, 4 July 2007</h2> <p><b>Łukasz Surma</b> (born on <a href="/wiki/June_28" title="June 28">June 28</a> , <a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a> in <a href="/wiki/Krak%C3%B3w" title="Kraków">Kraków</a>) is a <a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Polish</a> footballer (<a href="/wiki/Midfielder" title="Midfielder">midfielder</a>) playing currently for <a href="/wiki/Legia_Warszawa" title="Legia Warszawa" class="mw-redirect">Legia Warszawa</a>. He is a captain of this team . In the past years he played for such a clubs like <a href="/wiki/Ruch_Chorz%C3%B3w" title="Ruch Chorzów">Ruch Chorzów</a> (1998-2002) and <a href="/wiki/Wis%C5%82a_Krak%C3%B3w" title="Wisła Kraków">Wisła Kraków</a> (1996-1998). Łukasz Surma played also for <a href="/wiki/Poland_national_football_team" title="Poland national football team">Poland national football team</a> . in 5.7.2007 Lukasz Surma signed for Israeli side <a href="/wiki/Maccabi_Haifa_FC" title="Maccabi Haifa FC" class="mw-redirect">Maccabi Haifa FC</a>.</p> <table class="navbox" style="border-spacing:0"> <tr> <td style="padding:2px"> <table class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>*[http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2009-01-04/094716973534.shtml Biography of Li Zuopeng], at [[Sina.com]]. {{zh icon}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>{{Persondata &lt;!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --&gt;</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>| NAME              = Li, Zuopeng</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>| ALTERNATIVE NAMES =</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>| SHORT DESCRIPTION =</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td BIRTH    =</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>| DATE OF DEATH     =</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>| PLACE OF DEATH    =</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td colspan="2" class="diff-empty">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-marker">+</td>   <td class="diff-addedline"><div>}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{DEFAULTSORT:Li, Zuopeng}}</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>{{DEFAULTSORT:Li, Zuopeng}}</div></td> </tr> <tr>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:1914 births]]</div></td>   <td class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"><div>[[Category:1914 births]]</div></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 08:53, 8 October 2010</h2> <p><b>Li Zuopeng</b> (<a href="/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters" title="Simplified Chinese characters">simplified Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hans" xml:lang="zh-Hans">李作鹏</span>; <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">traditional Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant" xml:lang="zh-Hant">李作鵬</span>; <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">pinyin</a>: <i><span lang="zh-Latn-pinyin" xml:lang="zh-Latn-pinyin">Lǐ Zuòpéng</span></i>; April 24, 1914 – January 3, 2009) was a Chinese general of the <a href="/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army" title="People's Liberation Army">People's Liberation Army</a>.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Biography">Biography</span></h2> <p>Li was born in <a href="/wiki/Ji%27an" title="Ji'an">Ji'an</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jiangxi" title="Jiangxi">Jiangxi</a> in 1914. He joined the Red Army of the <a href="/wiki/Communist_Party_of_China" title="Communist Party of China">Communist Party of China</a> in 1930.</p> <p>In the <a href="/wiki/Cultural_Revolution" title="Cultural Revolution">Cultural Revolution</a>, Li was elected as the member of the <a href="/wiki/9th_Politburo_of_the_Communist_Party_of_China" title="9th Politburo of the Communist Party of China">9th Politburo of the Communist Party of China</a> in 1969. As an ally of <a href="/wiki/Lin_Biao" title="Lin Biao">Lin Biao</a>, he lost his position after Lin Biao's fall. He was put on trial and given a seventeen-year prison sentence in 1981.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2009-01-04/094716973534.shtml">Biography of Li Zuopeng</a>, at <a href="/wiki/Sina.com" title="Sina.com" class="mw-redirect">Sina.com</a>. <span class="languageicon" style="font-size:0.95em; font-weight:bold; color:#555;">(Chinese)</span></li> </ul> <table id="persondata" class="persondata noprint" style="border:1px solid #aaa; display:none; speak:none;"> <tr> <th colspan="2"><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Persondata" title="Wikipedia:Persondata">Persondata</a></th> </tr> <tr> <td class="persondata-label" style="color:#aaa;">Name</td> <td>Li, Zuopeng</td> </tr> <tr> <td class="persondata-label" style="color:#aaa;">Alternative names</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td class="persondata-label" style="color:#aaa;">Short description</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td class="persondata-label" style="color:#aaa;">Date of birth</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td class="persondata-label" style="color:#aaa;">Place of birth</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td class="persondata-label" style="color:#aaa;">Date of death</td> <td></td> </tr> <tr> <td class="persondata-label" style="color:#aaa;">Place of death</td> <td></td> </tr> </table> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg/30px-Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg" width="30" height="42" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg/45px-Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg/60px-Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg 2x" data-file-width="850" data-file-height="1200" /></a></td> <td><i>This biographical article related to the military of China is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Li_Zuopeng&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini" style="position: absolute; right: 15px; display: none;"> <ul> <li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:China-mil-bio-stub" title="Template:China-mil-bio-stub"><span title="View this class="diff-marker">&#160;</td>   <td class="diff-context"></td> </tr> </table><hr class='diff-hr' id='mw-oldid' /> 		<h2 class='diff-currentversion-title'>Revision as of 22:15, 3 November 2009</h2> <p><b>Li Zuopeng</b> (<a href="/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters" title="Simplified Chinese characters">simplified Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hans" xml:lang="zh-Hans">李作鹏</span>; <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">traditional Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant" xml:lang="zh-Hant">李作鵬</span>; <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">pinyin</a>: <i><span lang="zh-Latn-pinyin" xml:lang="zh-Latn-pinyin">Lǐ Zuòpéng</span></i>; April 24, 1914 – January 3, 2009) was a Chinese general of the <a href="/wiki/People%27s_Liberation_Army" title="People's Liberation Army">People's Liberation Army</a>.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Biography">Biography</span></h2> <p>Li was born in <a href="/wiki/Ji%27an" title="Ji'an">Ji'an</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jiangxi" title="Jiangxi">Jiangxi</a> in 1914. He joined the Red Army of the <a href="/wiki/Communist_Party_of_China" title="Communist Party of China">Communist Party of China</a> in 1930.</p> <p>In the <a href="/wiki/Cultural_Revolution" title="Cultural Revolution">Cultural Revolution</a>, Li was elected as the member of the <a href="/wiki/9th_Politburo_of_the_Communist_Party_of_China" title="9th Politburo of the Communist Party of China">9th Politburo of the Communist Party of China</a> in 1969. As an ally of <a href="/wiki/Lin_Biao" title="Lin Biao">Lin Biao</a>, he lost his position after Lin Biao's fall. He was put on trial and given a seventeen-year prison sentence in 1981.</p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2> <ul> <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2009-01-04/094716973534.shtml">Biography of Li Zuopeng</a>, at <a href="/wiki/Sina.com" title="Sina.com" class="mw-redirect">Sina.com</a>. <span class="languageicon" style="font-size:0.95em; font-weight:bold; color:#555;">(Chinese)</span></li> </ul> <p><br /></p> <table class="metadata plainlinks stub" role="presentation" style="background:transparent"> <tr> <td><a href="/wiki/File:Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Stub icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg/30px-Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg" width="30" height="42" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg/45px-Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg/60px-Chiang_Kai-shek.jpg 2x" data-file-width="850" data-file-height="1200" /></a></td> <td><i>This biographical article related to the military of China is a <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Stub" title="Wikipedia:Stub">stub</a>. You can help Wikipedia by <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Li_Zuopeng&amp;action=edit">expanding it</a>.</i> <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini" style="position: absolute; right: 15px; display: none;"> <ul> <li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:China-mil-bio-stub" title="Template:China-mil-bio-stub"><span title="View this template">v</span></a></li> <li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:China-mil-bio-stub" title="Template talk:China-mil-bio-stub"><span title="Discuss this template">t</span></a></li> <li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:China-mil-bio-stub&amp;action=edit"><span title="Edit this template">e</span></a></li> </ul> </div> </td> </tr> </table>   <!--  NewPP limit report Parsed by mw1172 CPU time usage: 0.099 seconds Real time usage: 0.132 seconds Preprocessor visited node count: 92/1000000 Preprocessor generated node count:
